meanings.definition: Watchful and ready to act or warn others.
meanings.sent1: The guard dog was alert and barked loudly when it sensed danger.
meanings.sent2: The lifeguard must stay alert to quickly respond to any swimmers in trouble.
meanings.sent3: The alert cat pounced on the toy mouse, thinking it was a real threat.
meanings.sent4: The alert firefighter rushed into the burning building to save the trapped residents.
meanings.sent5: The alert student noticed the mistake in the math problem immediately.

meanings.definition: A signal or sound to warn of danger.
meanings.sent1: The loud alert from the tornado siren made everyone seek shelter.
meanings.sent2: The alarm clock's alert woke me up for school every morning.
meanings.sent3: The alert of the car horn startled the pedestrians crossing the street.
meanings.sent4: The alert of the smoke detector indicated a possible fire in the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The alert of the phone notification reminded her of the upcoming meeting.

meanings.definition: A state of readiness or vigilance.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers were on high alert during the night patrol.
meanings.sent2: The lifeguard maintained a constant state of alert while on duty.
meanings.sent3: The alert of the security system put the homeowner at ease.
meanings.sent4: The alert of the police officers prevented a potential robbery at the bank.
meanings.sent5: The alert of the teacher ensured the safety of the students during the field trip.
